Package pool.poolModel

Class poolGame

java.lang.Object
pool.poolModel.poolGame
All Implemented Interfaces:
IpoolGame
public class poolGame extends Object implements IpoolGame
The game implementation of billard. Its part of the model of the game and can be used with a combination of view and controller or directly through the JShell.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(int widthBound, int heightBound)
      This method sets up a new Round of the Game. It clears all Balls from the previous Round and then adds new Balls which are forming a triangle, except oft the white ball which is located onm the other side of the table. After that the boolean "firstShot" is set to true to make sure game does not detect a foul. The method does this only when the boolean "end" is set to true. That is the case at the first start of the game and when a Frame (designation of a won Round) is finished. You call it with two integers which define the width and height of the window in which the game is displayed.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface IpoolGame
      Parameters:
      widthBound - horizontal width of the window where the game is displayed
      heightBound - vertical height of the window where the game is displayed

    • addPlayers

      public void addPlayers()
      This method adds the Players to the game. It pushes new Player Objects in the ArrayList where players ar saved.
      Specified by:
      addPlayers in interface IpoolGame

    • physics

      public void physics()
      This method is called every Frame and calls the ball collision detection of a ball with another ball or with the table edge. This is done for every ball of the game.
      Specified by:
      physics in interface IpoolGame

    • rotateQueue

      public float rotateQueue(float mouseX, float mouseY, float ballX, float ballY)
      This method is rotating the queue so that is always faces the white ball. Therefore, an angle is needed that indicates how far the queue needs to be rotated in the view. This is done by creating a Vector this indicates the position of the Mouse relative to the Ball. Then another Vector is created which only indicates the relative x-Axis position of the mouse to the Ball. After that the angle between those two Vectors is calculated. This is done with a formula where you dived the product of the two Vector through the product of the lengths of the Vectors. Then you need the arcos cosinus and the Math.toDegrees method to get the angle. Depending on the quarter where the mouse is, you have to add or substract something to or from the angle because of the sign of the Vector values. You need to call it with the x and y location of the mouse as well as the x and y location of the white ball as a float, and it returns the angle as a float.
      Specified by:
      rotateQueue in interface IpoolGame
      Parameters:
      mouseX - location of the mouse on the x-Axis
      mouseY - location of the mouse on the y-Axis
      ballX - location of the white ball on the x-Axis
      ballY - location of the white ball on th y-Axis
      Returns:
      the angle that is needed to rotate the queue as a float

    • shoot

      public void shoot(int power)
      This method shoots the white ball (id == 0) with a given power in the opposite direction of where the queue is pointing to. Therefore, the distUnit Vector which defines the direction of where the queue is pointing to is used but with a minus sign before it. You need to call it with an integer which defines the power and must be between 0 and 30.
      Specified by:
      shoot in interface IpoolGame
      Parameters:
      power - defines the hardness of a shot (max. 30)

    • ballInHand

      public void ballInHand(float mouseX, float mouseY)
      This method sets the white Ball to the location of the cursor until the Ball is laid on the table through a click. That is only done when the white Ball was potted or a Player made a foul. You need to call it with the x and y location of the mouse as a float.
      Specified by:
      ballInHand in interface IpoolGame
      Parameters:
      mouseX - location of the mouse on the x-Axis
      mouseY - location of the mouse on the y-Axis

    • setWhiteBall

      public void setWhiteBall(float mouseX, float mouseY)
      This method puts the whits ball back on the table to the location of the cursor after a "ball in hand". You need to call it with the x and y location of the mouse as a float.
      Specified by:
      setWhiteBall in interface IpoolGame
      Parameters:
      mouseX - location of the mouse on the x-Axis
      mouseY - location of the mouse on the y-Axis

    • setPottedBalls

      public void setPottedBalls()
      This method calls a method in the ball class that applies friction to the balls so that they slow down when rolling. In addition to that the number of currently potted Balls is set in every ball.
      Specified by:
      setPottedBalls in interface IpoolGame

    • checkFoul

      public boolean checkFoul()
      This method checks if a player has played foul. This is the case when a player did not hit a ball or the first ball he hit was one of the enemies or the black ball. It is also foul when you pot the black ball before you potted all of your balls. In this case the other player wins.
      Specified by:
      checkFoul in interface IpoolGame

    • checkShot

      public boolean checkShot()
      This method checks if any of the balls are still rolling. If so it is still a shot, if not it is not a shot anymore. It also checks if the white ball was potted. If so it's location is set to the side of the table where the potted balls are shown.
      Specified by:
      checkShot in interface IpoolGame

    • checkWhiteOverBall

      public boolean checkWhiteOverBall(float mouseX, float mouseY)
      This method checks if the position of the white ball is currently above another ball. It is needed when a player has "ball in hand" and wants to put the white back on the table. If the white ball is above another one, the player can't place it. Therefore, it is checked if the distance between the cursor and another ball is greater than one ball size. You need to call it with the x and y location of the mouse as a float, and it returns true if the white ball is above another ball and false if not.
      Specified by:
      checkWhiteOverBall in interface IpoolGame
      Parameters:
      mouseX - location of the mouse on the x-Axis
      mouseY - location of the mouse on the y-Axis
      Returns:
      true if the white ball is above another ball, false if not

    • switchPlayer

      public void switchPlayer()
      This method is used to switch between players. This is done by changing the "currentlyPlaying" variable in the player class to the opposite of what it was before calling the method.
      Specified by:
      switchPlayer in interface IpoolGame

    • pottedDuringShot

      public void pottedDuringShot()
      This method checks for every ball if it was potted during the last shot. If so it pushes the ball into a ArrayList where all the balls that where potted during the last shot ar saved.
      Specified by:
      pottedDuringShot in interface IpoolGame

    • setTeam

      public void setTeam()
      This method sets the team of a players based on what is potted first.
      Specified by:
      setTeam in interface IpoolGame

    • checkWin

      public boolean checkWin()
      This method checks if a player has won a frame. That is the case when a player potted all of his balls plus the black. That are seven balls. The method also sets the team of the players depending on the first ball that was potted during a frame. The player then gets the team of the ball.
      Specified by:
      checkWin in interface IpoolGame

    • getBalls

      public ArrayList<Ball> getBalls()
      This method return an ArrayList of all the balls of the game.
      Specified by:
      getBalls in interface IpoolGame
      Returns:
      ArrayList of all the balls of the game

    • getPlayers

      public ArrayList<Player> getPlayers()
      This method return an ArrayList of all the players of the game.
      Specified by:
      getPlayers in interface IpoolGame
      Returns:
      ArrayList of all the players of the game

    • getBallInHand

      public boolean getBallInHand()
      This method returns if a player has currently "ball in hand".
      Specified by:
      getBallInHand in interface IpoolGame
      Returns:
      a boolean that says if a player has currently "ball in hand"

    • setPottedBallCount

      public void setPottedBallCount(int pottedBallsCount)
      This method sets the amount of potted balls in a round. You need to call it with the amount of balls potted in the round as integer.
      Specified by:
      setPottedBallCount in interface IpoolGame
      Parameters:
      pottedBallsCount - amount of potted balls in a round as integer
